subject: Learning
title: The Impact of Poverty on Learning
description: Learn The Impact of Poverty on Learning in one minute.

hook.text: By age 3, children from low-income families have heard 30 million fewer words than affluent peers. The gap starts early.

buildup.text: Poverty affects learning through multiple pathways: nutrition, stress, healthcare access, and environmental stimulation.

discovery.text: Chronic stress from poverty raises cortisol, impairing memory, attention, and executive function in young brains.

twist.text: But poverty doesn't determine destiny. High-quality early education can significantly close achievement gaps.

climax.text: Programs like Head Start show that investing in early childhood education yields $7â€“$12 return for every $1 spent.

punchline.text: Poverty constrains learning. Opportunity expands it. Invest early and wisely.

quiz.question: How does chronic stress from poverty affect children's brains?
options: Elevated cortisol impairs memory, attention, and executive function
Stress has no measurable effect on brain development
